item.name: Antitoxin
entries: A creature that drinks this pink vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

item.name: Bottle of Good-Vibes
entries: This green vial has bits of some sort of herb floating around inside it. The bottle is made of degradable and burnable material.
When drunk, this potion grants the drinker a euphoria that is quite pleasant, while the taste is less so. This hits the user instantly and lasts {@dice 1d4} hours.
When left open, this potion bubbles and smoke starts releasing from the bottle. this may be passed around and enjoyed for {@dice 1d10 + 3} minutes of enjoyment.

When thrown, the potion and all of its contents burst out. The bottle ignites and its contents boil away, leaving a cloud of smoke in a 15-foot radius centered on where the bottle was thrown. Creatures that start their turn in the smoke make a DC 10 Con Save or have disadvantage on saves regarding illusions or charms for 1 minute.
Addictive 3

item.name: Cannabis Tincture
entries: This bitter, oily golden liquid warms the mouth wherever it touches. While under the effects of a Cannabis Tincture you gain {@dice 3d4} TempHP, you have a +1 to Constitution and Wisdom saving throws. Lasts 3 hours.
Used as a medium-strength painkiller. Has five doses, enough for 1 day of pain relief.
Addictive 2.

item.name: Doctor's Bag
entries: This kit is a cloth bag containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has 60 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|phb}) check.

item.name: Engineer's Pack
entries: This kit is a metallic pack containing tools, wires, conductors, fixtures, fasteners, and other gadgets and gizmos used in repairs. The kit has 200 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a construct that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|phb}) check.
One or more uses of this kit may be used to repair weapons, equipment, or other contraptions with the use of a successful tool check related to the equipment being repaired and ten minutes of time.

item.name: Flask of Oral Hygeine
entries: Smelling of mint and alcohol, this bottle is designated with a clear label disclosing its purpose and directions. When swished around the mouth, makes you feel minty fresh.
+1 TempHP
+1 to {@skill Persuasion|phb}

item.name: First-Aid Kit
entries: This kit is a small chest containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has 5 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|phb}) check.

item.name: Healer's Kit
entries: This kit is a leather case containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has 25 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|phb}) check.

item.name: Laudanum
entries: This extremely bitter liquid is faintly red when held up to a bright light. While under the effects of a Laudanum, you gain {@dice 1d4} HP and {@dice 1d8} TempHP, you have a +3 to Constitution and Wisdom saving throws, and you lose one tier of exhaustion. If the tier of exhaustion is gained from a Disease or Lingering Injury and is normally incurable until said disease or injury is removed, the tier of exhaustion is surpressed, losing it temporarily and regaining it at the end of the potion's duration. Lasts 4 hours.

Used as a painkiller and surpressant for the symptoms of disease or injury. Typically taken with some form of sugar to help it stay down. A single bottle of Laudanum is good for three doses, evenly spread throughout the day.
Addictive 3

item.name: Leather Collar
entries: Worn by pets and freaks alike.

item.name: Masterwork Spidersilk Armor
entries: The basis of this armor is made of spidersilk that has been weaved to be both light and durable whilst offering ample protection. It can go to a net of 9 without breaking, whilst providing ample AC benefit.
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.
{@b Masterwork.} This armor is crafted incredibly well.

item.name: Masterwork Spidersilk Caestus
entries: A caestus made from spidersilk, worn by one hand. it provides a benefit to armor class and can be used to parry attacks. You can benefit from only one shield at a time. It can go to a net of -1 without breaking.

While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC. If the shield has the ability to parry, it gains a +1 bonus to the result of any parrying roll made by it.
{@b Masterwork.} This item is crafted incredibly well.

item.name: Masterwork Spidersilk Clothing
entries: Clothing made from spidersilk is light and durable, being able to go to a net of 9 without breaking. This clothing is able to be worn whilst sleeping and has an increased AC to regular clothing.
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this clothing.
{@b Masterwork.} This armor is crafted incredibly well.

item.name: Mechanical Supplies
entries: This kit is a collection of conductors, plates, springs, fasteners, and other pieces of scrap metal for use in general repairs. Over the course of a short rest, you may transfer over supplies from this box to a mechanical kit of your choice. The kit has enough supplies to refil 50 charges.
One of more uses of this kit may be used to repair weapons, equipment, or other contraptions with the use of a successful tool check related to the equipment being repaired and ten minutes of time.

item.name: Medical Supplies
entries: This kit is a big leather and cloth box containing bandages, salves, and splints. Over the course of a short rest, you may transfer over supplies from this box to a medical kit of your choice. The kit has enough supplies to refil 125 charges.

item.name: Medkit
entries: This kit is a aluminum box containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has 12 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine|phb}) check.

item.name: Metal Collar
entries: Perfect for taming creatures that really don't want to be domesticated, whether that be beast or man.

item.name: Milk of the Poppy
entries: This tiny vial of white liquid tastes bitter; though the ability to taste quickly vanishes along with any other sensation as you drink it. You gain {@dice 5d4 + 5} tempHP from drinking this tiny vial of white liquid. While under the drink's effects, the creature is numb to all but severe magical pain, giving them +5 to Constitution saving throws. They also temporarily gain one tier of exhaustion during the potion's duration from being drowsy, and can fall asleep if given 1 minute to do so uninterupted. A creature immune to being {@condition poisoned|phb} does not gain the tier of exhaustion. While asleep, the creature can not wake up until the potion has expired. Lasts 3 hours.
Used as a severe painkiller ad sedative for especially painful surgeries and during war.
Addictive 5

item.name: Oil (Flask)
entries: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet normally, or up to 60 feet at disadvantage, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an adition {@dice 1d8} fire damage from the burning oil. Alternatively or should the oil miss, it covers a five-foot square. Any fire damage that hits the oil causes it to burn for 1 minute. Anything that enters or starts its turn in the burning oil must make a DC 14 Dexterity save or suffer {@dice 1d8} fire damage if they have not already suffered the damage from being covered in burning oil.

item.name: Oil (Jug)
entries: This jug contains 1 gallon of oil. Can be used to fill 8 clay flasks.

item.name: Oil of Acid
entries: This sour fizzy liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Acid damage.

item.name: Oil of Cold
entries: This slippery minty liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Cold damage.

item.name: Oil of Defence
entries: This sluggish thick liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one piece of armor, natural or otherwise, or shield. If you apply this to natural armor that you are not using, this confers no benefit to you. Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to AC.

item.name: Oil of Etherealness
entries: Beads of this cloudy gray oil form on the outside of its container and quickly evaporate. The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying this oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of the {@spell etherealness|phb} spell for 1 hour.

item.name: Oil of Fire
entries: This thin spicy liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Fire damage.

item.name: Oil of Force
entries: This evaporating sweet liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Force damage.

item.name: Oil of Greater Repair
entries: When applied to a construct's wounds, heals {@dice 2d10} hit points. The oil's purple liquid quickly vanishes when poured.

item.name: Oil of Lesser Repair
entries: When applied to a construct's wounds, heals {@dice 1d4} hit points. The oil's purple liquid quickly vanishes when poured.

item.name: Oil of Lightning
entries: This jittery fizzy liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Lightning damage.

item.name: Oil of Magic
entries: This fizzy thick liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

item.name: Oil of Mending
entries: This sticky white paste may ment two things together when held in place for at least 1 round, acting as if conjoined by the {@spell mending|phb} spell. When poured onto a construct's wounds, they heal {@dice 2d6} hp.

item.name: Oil of Necrosis
entries: This sickly putrid liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Necrotic damage.

item.name: Oil of Petrification Revival
entries: This murky brown miracle fluid can be extremely rarely found naturally dripping in caves where bats are present. A creature can spend 1 minute applying the oil to another creature that has been {@condition petrified|phb}, causing the {@condition petrified|phb} condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature's next turn.

item.name: Oil of Poison
entries: This bitter slimy liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Poison damage.

item.name: Oil of Psychosis
entries: This sticky bitter liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Psychic damage.

item.name: Oil of Radiance
entries: This glowing metallic liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Radiant damage.

item.name: Oil of Repair
entries: When applied to a construct's wounds, heals {@dice 1d10} hit points. The oil's purple liquid quickly vanishes when poured.

item.name: Oil of Sharpness
entries: This clear, gelatinous oil sparkles with tiny, ultrathin silver shards. The oil can coat one slashing or piercing weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of slashing or piercing ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

item.name: Oil of Slipperiness
entries: This sticky black unguent is thick and heavy in the container, but it flows quickly when poured. The oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains he effect of a {@spell freedom of movement|phb} spell for 8 hours.
Alternatively, the oil can be poured on the ground as an action, where it covers a 10-foot square, duplicating the effect of the {@spell grease|cooms} spell in that area for 8 hours.

item.name: Oil of Superior Repair
entries: When applied to a construct's wounds, heals {@dice 4d10} hit points. The oil's purple liquid quickly vanishes when poured.

item.name: Oil of Supreme Repair
entries: When applied to a construct's wounds, heals {@dice 8d10} hit points. The oil's purple liquid quickly vanishes when poured.

item.name: Oil of Thunder
entries: This warbling fizzy liquid bubbles and oozes with energy. The oil can coat one weapon, natural or otherwise, or up to 5 pieces of ammuntion. Applying the oil takes 1 minute. For 1 hour, the coated item is magical and has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls and deals {@dice 1d4} Thunder damage.

item.name: Oil of Ultimate Repair
entries: When applied to a construct's wounds, heals {@dice 16d10} hit points. The oil's purple liquid quickly vanishes when poured.

item.name: Perfume (Flask)
entries: With a few spritzes of this beautiful aroma placed on your person, people tend to like you more.
+3 to {@skill Persuasion|phb}
+3 to {@skill Deception|phb}

item.name: Perfume (Vial)
entries: With a few spritzes of this beautiful aroma placed on your person, people tend to like you more.
+3 to {@skill Persuasion|phb}
+3 to {@skill Deception|phb}

item.name: Potion of Acid Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to acid damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Awakening
entries: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against sleep and exhaustion for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

item.name: Potion of Climbing
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed for 1 hour. During that time, you have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics|phb}) checks you make to climb. The potion is seperated into brown, silver, and grey layers resembling bands of stone. Shaking the bottle fails to mix the colors.

item.name: Potion of Cold Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to cold damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Fire Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to fire damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Force Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to force damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Greater Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Greater Health
entries: The thick red liquid sticks to the side of the glass almost like a syrup. When you drink this potion, you regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb} conditions.

item.name: Potion of Greater Magic
entries: You can recover a total number of combined spell slot levels equal to or less than {@dice 1d4 + 1} when you drink this potion. Innate Spellcating may be recovered by this potion as if it were a slot level equal to its spell level. The level of spell slots gained may not exceed 3. The blue liquid constantly evaporates and condenses into a blue haze within the flask.
Sorcerers may divy up the number rolled into sorcery points as well.
Paladins may divy up the number rolled into their Lay on Hands, regaining 5 hp per point expended in this fashion.
Artificers pour this potion onto their tools of trade, rather than drink the potion.
Warlocks may pour this on the relic of their pact in order to transfer this magic to their patron, gaining 2 spell slot for their pact magic back.

item.name: Potion of Greater Regeneration
entries: A creature who drinks this lavander brew has their natural healing ability both stimulated and accelerated. For 1 hour, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of their turns (10 hit points each minute). In addition, once per turn for the duration of the potion, the drinker can choose to perform a healing surge, rolling a hit die to recover HP.

The imbiber's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored by the end of the potion. If they have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the potion instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

item.name: Potion of Greater Restoration
entries: The clear red liquid has tiny bubbles of light in it. When you drink this potion, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb} conditions.

item.name: Potion of Greater Spirit
entries: You restore {@dice 2d2 + 1} expended uses of a resource or ability (e.g. Action Surge, Ki, Channel Divinity, Wild Shape, etc.) that regains on a short rest. Alternatively, should you wish to regain a long rest ability, the cost is doubled (e.g. Rage, Arcane Recovery, Breath Weapon, Relentless Endurance, Innate Spellcasting, etc.). This potion's yellow liquid glows when disturbed.

item.name: Potion of Greater Stamina
entries: You gain {@dice 2d8} temporary hit points and lose {@dice 1d2 + 1} tiers of exhaustion when you drink this potion. You may exchange 3 exhaustion tier recoveries to instead recover an expent hit die. On top of this, any lingering injury sustained by the drinker is reduced by a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d20}. This potion's green liquid fizzes if shaken or opened.

item.name: Potion of Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Health
entries: The thick red liquid sticks to the side of the glass almost like a syrup. When you drink this potion, you regain {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points, and it either cures any disease afflicting you, or it removes the {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb} conditions.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 1d4 + 1} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Health
entries: The thick red liquid sticks to the side of the glass almost like a syrup. When you drink this potion, you regain {@dice 1d4 + 1} hit points, and it can end either one disease or one condition afflicting you. The condition can be {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb}.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Magic
entries: You can recover a level 1 spell slot when you drink this potion. Innate Spellcating may be recovered by this potion as if it were a slot level equal to its spell level. The blue liquid constantly evaporates and condenses into a blue haze within the flask.
Sorcerers may instead gain a sorcery point.
Paladins may instead gain 5 lay on hands points back.
Artificers pour this potion onto their tools of trade, rather than drink the potion.
Warlocks may pour this on the relic of their pact in order to transfer this magic to their patron. They must then roll a {@dice 1d2}, gaining a spell slot back on a 2.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Regeneration
entries: A creature who drinks this lavander brew has their natural healing ability both stimulated and accelerated. For 1 minute, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of their turns (10 hit points total). In addition, once per turn for the duration of the potion, the drinker can choose to perform a healing surge, rolling a hit die to recover HP.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Restoration
entries: The clear red liquid has tiny bubbles of light in it. When you drink this potion, it can end either one disease or one condition afflicting you. The condition can be {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb}.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Spirit
entries: You restore an expended use of a resource or ability (e.g. Action Surge, Ki, Channel Divinity, Wild Shape, etc.) that regains on a short rest. This potion's yellow liquid glows when disturbed.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Stamina
entries: You gain {@dice 1d4} temporary hit points and lose {@dice 1d2 - 1} tiers of exhaustion when you drink this potion. On top of this, any lingering injury sustained by the drinker is reduced by an hour. This potion's green liquid fizzes if shaken or opened.

item.name: Potion of lightning Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to lightning damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Magic
entries: You can recover {@dice 1d2} level 1 spell slots when you drink this potion. Innate Spellcating may be recovered by this potion as if it were a slot level equal to its spell level. The blue liquid constantly evaporates and condenses into a blue haze within the flask.
Sorcerers may divy up the number rolled into sorcery points as well.
Paladins may divy up the number rolled into their Lay on Hands, regaining 5 hp per point expended in this fashion.
Artificers pour this potion onto their tools of trade, rather than drink the potion.
Warlocks may pour this on the relic of their pact in order to transfer this magic to their patron, gaining 1 spell slot for their pact magic back.

item.name: Potion of Natural Ability
entries: This magical potion seems to contain floating scales, feathers, and small tufts of fur. Opening the cork reveals a musky odor. Drinking this potion recovers all expended uses of your racial abilities.

item.name: Potion of Natural Magic
entries: This magical blue potion is corked with the claw of a dire wolf. Opening the cork reveals a musky odor. Drinking this potion recovers all expended uses of your innate spellcasting.

item.name: Potion of Necrotic Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to necrotic damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Poison Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to poison damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Psychic Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to psychic damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Radiant Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to radiant damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Regeneration
entries: A creature who drinks this lavander brew has their natural healing ability both stimulated and accelerated. For 10 minutes, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of their turns (10 hit points each minute). In addition, once per turn for the duration of the potion, the drinker can choose to perform a healing surge, rolling a hit die to recover HP.

item.name: Potion of Restoration
entries: The clear red liquid has tiny bubbles of light in it. When you drink this potion, it either cures any disease afflicting you, or it removes the {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb} conditions.

item.name: Potion of Spirit
entries: You restore {@dice 1d2} expended uses of a resource or ability (e.g. Action Surge, Ki, Channel Divinity, Wild Shape, etc.) that regains on a short rest. Alternatively, should you wish to regain a long rest ability, the cost is doubled (e.g. Rage, Arcane Recovery, Breath Weapon, Relentless Endurance, Innate Spellcasting, etc.). This potion's yellow liquid glows when disturbed.

item.name: Potion of Stamina
entries: You gain {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points and lose {@dice 1d2} tiers of exhaustion when you drink this potion. On top of this, any lingering injury sustained by the drinker is reduced by a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d4}. This potion's green liquid fizzes if shaken or opened.

item.name: Potion of Superior Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 8d4 + 8} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Superior Health
entries: The thick red liquid sticks to the side of the glass almost like a syrup. When you drink this potion, you regain {@dice 8d4 + 8} hit points, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned} conditions. On top of this, you can reduce your {@condition exhaustion} level by one, or end one of the following effects on yourself:
One effect that {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition petrified|phb} yourself.
One curse, including your attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of your ability scores.
One effect reducing your hit point maximum.

item.name: Potion of Superior Magic
entries: You can recover a total number of combined spell slot levels equal to or less than {@dice 1d8 + 2} when you drink this potion. Innate Spellcating may be recovered by this potion as if it were a slot level equal to its spell level. The level of spell slots gained may not exceed 5. The blue liquid constantly evaporates and condenses into a blue haze within the flask.
Sorcerers may divy up the number rolled into sorcery points as well.
Paladins may divy up the number rolled into their Lay on Hands, regaining 5 hp per point expended in this fashion.
Artificers pour this potion onto their tools of trade, rather than drink the potion.
Warlocks may pour this on the relic of their pact in order to transfer this magic to their patron, gaining 3 spell slot for their pact magic back.

For 10 minutes, the target regains 6 hit points at the start of each of their turns (60 hit points each minute). In addition, once per turn for the duration of the potion, the drinker can choose to perform a healing surge, rolling a hit die to recover HP.

The imbiber's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored by the end of the potion. If they have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the potion instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

When you drink this potion, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb} conditions. On top of this, you can reduce your {@condition exhaustion|phb} level by one, or end one of the following effects on yourself:
One effect that {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition petrified|phb} yourself.
One curse, including your attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of your ability scores.
One effect reducing your hit point maximum.

You may exchange 3 exhaustion tier recoveries to instead recover an expent hit die, or 4 exhaustion tier recoveries to recover a single tier of {@i bestir exhaustion} following the normal rules for recovering such a tier. On top of this, any lingering injury sustained by the drinker is reduced by a number of days equal to {@dice 2d4}. This potion's green liquid fizzes if shaken or opened.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 10d4 + 20} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Health
entries: The thick red liquid sticks to the side of the glass almost like a syrup. When you drink this potion, you regain {@dice 10d4 + 20} hit points, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned} conditions. On top of this, you can reduce your {@condition exhaustion} level by two, or end one of the following effects on yourself:
One effect that {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition petrified|phb} yourself.
One curse, including your attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of your ability scores.
One effect reducing your hit point maximum.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Magic
entries: You can recover a total number of combined spell slot levels equal to or less than {@dice 1d12 + 8} when you drink this potion. Innate Spellcating may be recovered by this potion as if it were a slot level equal to its spell level. The level of spell slots gained may not exceed 7. The blue liquid constantly evaporates and condenses into a blue haze within the flask.
Sorcerers may divy up the number rolled into sorcery points as well.
Paladins may divy up the number rolled into their Lay on Hands, regaining 5 hp per point expended in this fashion.
Artificers pour this potion onto their tools of trade, rather than drink the potion.
Warlocks may pour this on the relic of their pact in order to transfer this magic to their patron, gaining 4 spell slot for their pact magic back.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Regeneration
entries: A creature who drinks this lavander brew has their natural healing ability both stimulated and accelerated. For 1 minutes, the target regains 60 hit points at the start of each of their turns (600 hit points each minute). In addition, once per turn for the duration of the potion, the drinker can choose to perform a healing surge, rolling a hit die to recover HP.

The imbiber's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored by the end of the potion. If they have the severed part and hold it to the stump, the potion instantaneously causes the limb to knit to the stump.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Restoration
entries: The clear red liquid has tiny bubbles of light in it. When you drink this potion, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb} conditions. On top of this, you can reduce your {@condition exhaustion|phb} level by two, or end one of the following effects on yourself:
One effect that {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition petrified|phb} yourself.
One curse, including your attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of your ability scores.
One effect reducing your hit point maximum.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Spirit
entries: You restore {@dice 3d4 + 4} expended uses of a resource or ability (e.g. Action Surge, Ki, Channel Divinity, Wild Shape, etc.) that regains on a short rest. Alternatively, should you wish to regain a long rest ability, the cost is doubled (e.g. Rage, Arcane Recovery, Breath Weapon, Relentless Endurance, Innate Spellcasting, etc.). This potion's yellow liquid glows when disturbed.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Stamina
entries: You gain {@dice 4d12} temporary hit points and lose {@dice 2d4 + 2} tiers of exhaustion when you drink this potion. You may exchange 3 exhaustion tier recoveries to instead recover an expent hit die, or 4 exhaustion tier recoveries to recover a single tier of {@i bestir exhaustion} following the normal rules for recovering such a tier, or 6 exhaustion tier recoveries to cure yourself of a single disease. On top of this, any lingering injury sustained by the drinker is reduced by a number of days equal to {@dice 4d6}. This potion's green liquid fizzes if shaken or opened.

item.name: Potion of Thunder Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to thunder damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Ultimate Healing
entries: You regain {@dice 20d4 + 50} hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

item.name: Potion of Ultimate Health
entries: The thick red liquid sticks to the side of the glass almost like a syrup. When you drink this potion, you regain {@dice 20d4 + 50} hit points, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned} conditions. On top of this, you remove all {@condition exhaustion} affecting you and end any of the following effects on yourself:
One effect that {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition petrified|phb} yourself.
One curse, including your attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of your ability scores.
One effect reducing your hit point maximum.

item.name: Potion of Ultimate Magic
entries: You can recover a total number of combined spell slot levels equal to or less than {@dice 1d20 + 10} when you drink this potion. Innate Spellcating may be recovered by this potion as if it were a slot level equal to its spell level. The blue liquid constantly evaporates and condenses into a blue haze within the flask.
Sorcerers may divy up the number rolled into sorcery points as well.
Paladins may divy up the number rolled into their Lay on Hands, regaining 5 hp per point expended in this fashion.
Artificers pour this potion onto their tools of trade, rather than drink the potion.
Warlocks may pour this on the relic of their pact in order to transfer this magic to their patron, gaining 4 spell slot for their pact magic back as well as 1 use of an expent Mystic Arcanum.

item.name: Potion of Ultimate Regeneration
entries: A creature who drinks this lavander brew has their natural healing ability both stimulated and accelerated. The drinker immediately gains 600 hit points, and may additionally choose to roll a hit die to gain more hp.
The imbiber's severed body members (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are instantly restored.

item.name: Potion of Ultimate Restoration
entries: The clear red liquid has tiny bubbles of light in it. When you drink this potion, it cures any disease afflicting you, and it removes the {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, {@condition paralyzed|phb}, or {@condition poisoned|phb} conditions. item.name: Potion of Ultimate Spirit
entries: You restore {@dice 4d6 + 8} expended uses of a resource or ability (e.g. Action Surge, Ki, Channel Divinity, Wild Shape, etc.) that regains on a short rest. Alternatively, should you wish to regain a long rest ability, the cost is doubled (e.g. Rage, Arcane Recovery, Breath Weapon, Relentless Endurance, Innate Spellcasting, etc.). This potion's yellow liquid glows when disturbed.

item.name: Potion of Ultimate Stamina
entries: You gain {@dice 5d20} temporary hit points and lose {@dice 4d4 + 4} tiers of exhaustion when you drink this potion. You may exchange 3 exhaustion tier recoveries to instead recover an expent hit die, or 4 exhaustion tier recoveries to recover a single tier of {@i bestir exhaustion} following the normal rules for recovering such a tier, or 6 exhaustion tier recoveries to cure yourself of a single disease. On top of this, any lingering injury sustained by the drinker is reduced by a number of days equal to {@dice 8d6}. This potion's green liquid fizzes if shaken or opened.

item.name: Potion of Watchful Rest
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the following benefits for the next 8 hours: magic can't put you to sleep, and you can remain awake during a long rest and still gain its benefits. This sweet, amber-colored brew has no effect on creatures that don't require sleep, such as elves.

item.name: Potion of Water Breathing
entries: You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion. Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

item.name: Repair Kit
entries: This kit is a small clamping box that contains enough materials for a few small repairs. The kit has 5 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a construct that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|phb}) check.
One or more uses of this kit may be used to repair weapons, equipment, or other contraptions with the use of a successful tool check related to the equipment being repaired and ten minutes of time.

item.name: Spidersilk Armor
entries: The basis of this armor is made of spidersilk that has been weaved to be both light and durable whilst offering ample protection. It can go to a net of 9 without breaking, whilst providing ample AC benefit.

item.name: Spidersilk Caestus
entries: A caestus made from spidersilk, worn by one hand. it provides a benefit to armor class and can be used to parry attacks. You can benefit from only one shield at a time. It can go to a net of -1 without breaking.

item.name: Spidersilk Clothing
entries: Clothing made from spidersilk is light and durable, being able to go to a net of 9 without breaking. This clothing is able to be worn whilst sleeping and has an increased AC to regular clothing.

item.name: Spidersilk Armor +1
entries: The basis of this armor is made of spidersilk that has been weaved to be both light and durable whilst offering ample protection. It can go to a net of 9 without breaking, whilst providing ample AC benefit.
You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC. If the shield has the ability to parry, it gains a +1 bonus to the result of any parrying roll made by it.

item.name: Technician's Kit
entries: This kit is a metal case containing tools, fasteners, conductors, and other scrap metal used for repairs. The kit has 75 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a construct that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|phb}) check.
One or more uses of this kit may be used to repair weapons, equipment, or other contraptions with the use of a successful tool check related to the equipment being repaired and ten minutes of time.

item.name: Toolbox
entries: This kit is a aluminum box that contains tools, fasteners, and scrap metal used for general repairs. The kit has 30 uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabalize a construct that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|phb}) check.
One or more uses of this kit may be used to repair weapons, equipment, or other contraptions with the use of a successful tool check related to the equipment being repaired and ten minutes of time.

item.name: Willowshade Oil
entries: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been {@condition petrified|phb} for less than 1 minute, causing the {@condition petrified|phb} condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature's next turn.

magicvariant.name: Adamantine Ammunition
entries: Ammunition made of adamantine is capable of going to a net of -1 without breaking. It can't break, chip, or be damaged by most mundane means. Ammunition made of adamantine have an increased chance to score a critical hit that scales with the enchantment bonus of the weapon used.

Adamantine Armor has a passive DR against non-magical physical damage depending on their weight class, that scales with their enchantment bonus.

While holding this shield, you have a {=bonusAc} bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC. If the shield has the ability to parry, it gains a {=bonusAc} bonus to the result of any parrying roll made by it.
{@b Magical.} This item is magical.

This shield is reinforced with adamantine, enabling it to go to a net of -1 without breaking. It can't break, chip, or be damaged by most mundane means. Adamantine shields has a passive DR against non-magical physical damage depending on their weight class, as well as an increased chance to score a critical hit that scales with their enchantment bonus.

While holding this shield, you have a {=bonusAc} bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC. If the shield has the ability to parry, it gains a {=bonusAc} bonus to the result of any parrying roll made by it.
{@b Magical.} This item is magical.

This tool is made of adamantine, enabling it to go to a net of -1 without breaking. It can't break, chip, or be damaged by most mundane means. Tools made of adamantine have an increased chance to roll a critical that scales with the enchantment bonus of the tool.
You have a +3 bonus to all checks made using this magic tool. If you are an artificer and proficient with the tool, it counts as a +3 arcane focus for you.

This weapon is made of adamantine, enabling it to go to a net of -1 without breaking. It can't break, chip, or be damaged by most mundane means. Weapons made of adamantine have an increased chance to score a critical hit that scales with the enchantment bonus of the weapon.
You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
{@b Magical.} This item is magical.

{@b Masterwork.} This item is crafted incredibly well.

You have a {=bonusWeapon} bonus to all attack, damage, and healing rolls made using this masterwork focus. Additionally, you have a {=bonusSpellSaveDc} bonus to your Spell Save DC on spells cast using this focus.
{@b Masterwork.} This item is crafted incredibly well.
